channel.title: DC when attacking Npc
channel.description: I had this problem before but I'm coming back into RSPS's and I forgot what the fix was.. This is the code it shoots through the server's "run" cmd prompt.. [code]Error with player 1, Ethan java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 18 at client.AttackNPC(client.java:6539) at client.process(client.java:16775) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.j at process.run(process.java:23) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)[/code]

item.title: DC when attacking Npc
item.dc:creator: @DemisePking DemisePking
item.description:
@DemisePking wrote:

uve entered an invalid emote or something else it doesnt recognise into the npchandler. search for the npc’s id and see if you can find what wrong with the code surrounding it.

I had this when i made saradomin wizards die with a negative emote.

Read full topic

item.title: DC when attacking Npc
item.dc:creator: @Ebowne24 Ebowne24
item.description:
@Ebowne24 wrote:

I’ve tested Chaos Druid and rock crabs so far. That’s all I really needed to don’t you think?

Read full topic

item.title: DC when attacking Npc
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Thanks

I was thinking that one of those variables would be the problem, but alas.

Most likely this is causing the error:

Server.NPCHandler.npcs[attacknpc]

It’s calling an array with a wrong index. The array in question is either Autospawn or NPClist (.cfg)

Does this error occur everytime you attack any npc? or only certain npcs?

Read full topic

item.title: DC when attacking Npc
item.dc:creator: @Ebowne24 Ebowne24
item.description:
@Ebowne24 wrote:

Nice to see you again, Relmitos. Glad to see you’re still here.

public static boolean IsDropping = false; public static int maxNPCs = 10000; public static int maxListedNPCs = 10000; // npc list every npc listed no // duplicates -bakatool public static int maxNPCDrops = 10000; public static int maxNPCSpawns = 10000; // spawns could be same npc multiple // times -bakatool

Read full topic

item.title: DC when attacking Npc
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Have a look in the NPCHandler class, and check these variables:

maxNPCs
maxNPCSpawns
maxListedNPCs

What are their values?

Read full topic
